item.title: NPCHandler.java error
item.dc:creator: @Swift_Sk Swift Sk
item.description:
@Swift_Sk wrote:

[quote=“JRealm, post:7, topic:199839”]Change the hasset to:

if (ppl.hasset == 1) { [/quote]
ty
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 14, 2008, 11:46:29 AM[/size][hr]so it will like:

public void agrovateNpcs() {
client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
if (p != null) {
client person = (client) p;
if (person != null) {
for (int i = 0; i < maxNPCs; i ++) {
if (npcs[i] != null) {
if (person.willBeAgressed()) { //Newly added if-then block.
if (ppl.hasset == 1) {
if (npcs[i].npcType == 19) {
npcs[i].StartKilling = person.playerId;
npcs[i].RandomWalk = false;
npcs[i].IsUnderAttack = true;
npcs[i].followPlayer = person.playerId;
}

					}
					}
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

item.title: NPCHandler.java error
item.dc:creator: @Swift_Sk Swift Sk
item.description:
@Swift_Sk wrote:

[quote=“JRealm, post:4, topic:199839”] Well. From what method have you got that if statement with the integer located?[/quote]

[code]

public void agrovateNpcs() {
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
if (p != null) {
client person = (client) p;
if (person != null) {
for (int i = 0; i < maxNPCs; i ++) {
if (npcs[i] != null) {
if (person.willBeAgressed()) { //Newly added if-then block.
if (hasset == 1) {
if (npcs[i].npcType == 19) {
npcs[i].StartKilling = person.playerId;
npcs[i].RandomWalk = false;
npcs[i].IsUnderAttack = true;
npcs[i].followPlayer = person.playerId;
}

					}
					}
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 14, 2008, 11:41:32 AM[/size][hr][quote=“zubmage, post:5, topic:199839”] client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player];

Then:
